thread.title: “The Hill” Published a Landslide of Pro-Clinton Posts That May Point to 1 Thing
thread.title_full: “The Hill” Published a Landslide of Pro-Clinton Posts That May Point to 1 Thing

author: K. Campbell
title: “The Hill” Published a Landslide of Pro-Clinton Posts That May Point to 1 Thing
text:
In fact, her own chief of staff, Bari Lurie, told The Hill that Clinton wasn’t interested in political office. 
“She is not running,” Lurie explained. 
But, that didn’t stop The Hill from titling the article, “Chelsea Clinton fuels speculation of political run.” Their evidence? Clinton has been outspoken on social media about her disagreements with President Donald Trump and other political leaders. Advertisement - story continues below 
If that’s The Hill’s criteria for someone planning to run for office, they better start looking into the millions of other people who voice their political beliefs on social media on a daily basis. 
The truth is that the liberals at The Hill have been so distraught by their great political loss in 2016 that they can’t think about anything else and have pushed the Chelsea Clinton political narrative for their own feel-good purpose. 
(Although, I’m not sure how having a Clinton running for office could make anyone feel better.) 
“Who looks around and sees a party laid to ruins by Hillary’s disastrous campaign and thinks ‘I know! Let’s get her kid to run for office!’” conservative news site Red State wondered in a recent article titled, “She’s Not a Thing. Stop Making Chelsea Clinton a Thing.” Advertisement - story continues below
